sen.j: 滋賀県（しがけん）は、琵琶湖を取り囲んでいる近畿地方の内陸県。
sen.e: Shiga, in Kinki region, is an inland prefecture that encompasses Lake Biwa (Biwako).
Shiga, in the Kinki region, is an inland prefecture that encompasses Lake Biwa (Biwako).
sen.cmt: in the Kinki regionとしました。
sen.e: Shiga, in the Kinki region, is an inland prefecture that encompasses Lake Biwa (Biwako).

sen.j: 都道府県庁所在地は大津市。
sen.e: The capital of the prefecture is located in Otsu City.
sen.cmt: 「都道府県庁所在地」より「県庁所在地」の方が文脈にあう、と思い変更しています。
sen.e: The capital of the prefecture is located in Otsu City.
The capital of the prefecture is located in Otsu City.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 令制国の近江国と一致する。
sen.e: Shiga Prefecture corresponds with Omi Province under the system of 'ryoseikoku (province).'
Shiga Prefecture corresponds with Omi Province under the system of 'ryoseikoku' (province).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置を移動
sen.e: Shiga Prefecture corresponds with Omi Province under the system of 'ryoseikoku' (province).

sen.j: 県名は大津が属していた郡名（滋賀郡）から採用された。
sen.e: The name, 'Shiga,' was adopted from the name of the county (Shiga county), to which Otsu belonged.
The name, 'Shiga,' was adopted from the name of the county (Shiga County), to which Otsu belonged.
The name, 'Shiga,' was adopted from the name of the county (Shiga County), to which Otsu belonged.

sen.j: 共通語では「滋賀」は頭高型アクセントで発音するが、地元の方言（近江弁）では尾高型で発音する。
sen.e: The stress is placed on the first syllable in standard Japanese while it is placed on the second syllable in the local dialect ('Omi ben').
The stress is placed on the first syllable in standard Japanese while it is placed on the second syllable in the local dialect ('Omi ben').
The stress is placed on the first syllable in standard Japanese while it is placed on the second syllable in the local dialect ('Omi ben').

sen.j: 都道府県の面積一覧は全国で10番目に狭く、内陸県では奈良県、埼玉県に次いで狭い。
sen.e: The area of Shiga Prefecture is the tenth smallest in Japan, and the third, following Nara and Saitama Prefectures, of the inland prefectures.
The area of Shiga Prefecture is the tenth smallest in Japan, and the third, following Nara and Saitama Prefectures, of the inland prefectures.
The area of Shiga Prefecture is the tenth smallest in Japan, and the third, following Nara and Saitama Prefectures, of the inland prefectures.

sen.j: その狭い面積の半分以上を山地と琵琶湖が占めており、都道府県の面積一覧2001年 可住地面積の順位は大阪府よりも狭い。
sen.e: More than half of the small area is occupied by mountains and Lake Biwa, so the inhabitable land area of Shiga measured in 2001 was smaller than that of Osaka.
More than half of the small area is occupied by mountains and Lake Biwa, so the inhabitable land area of Shiga measured in 2001 was smaller than that of Osaka.
More than half of the small area is occupied by mountains and Lake Biwa, so the inhabitable land area of Shiga measured in 2001 was smaller than that of Osaka.

sen.j: 「近江」が「ちかつあはうみ（都近くの淡水湖）」に由来し、現在も滋賀県が「湖国」と呼ばれることからも窺えるように、県の中央に位置する琵琶湖は本県のシンボルである。
sen.e: As it can be guessed from the facts that 'Omi' derived from 'Chikatsu awaumi (a fresh-water lake near the capital)' and Shiga is called a 'Lake Country,' Lake Biwa, which is located in the center of the prefecture, is a symbol of Shiga.

As it can be guessed from the facts that 'Omi' derived from 'Chikatsu awaumi (a fresh-water lake near the capital)' and Shiga is called a 'Lake Country,' Lake Biwa, which is located in the center of the prefecture, is a symbol of Shiga.

As it can be guessed from the facts that 'Omi' derived from 'Chikatsu awaumi (a fresh-water lake near the capital)' and Shiga is called a 'Lake Country,' Lake Biwa, which is located in the center of the prefecture, is a symbol of Shiga.

sen.j: 産業用水や、近隣府県約1400万人の飲用水の源として重要であり、また観光資源としてもその存在は大きい。
sen.e: The lake is important as sources for industrial water and drinking water for 14 million people living in neighboringprefectures and as tourism resources.
The lake is important as sources for industrial water and drinking water for 14 million people living in neighboringprefectures and as tourism resources.
The lake is important as sources for industrial water and drinking water for 14 million people living in neighboringprefectures and as tourism resources.

sen.j: 琵琶湖があることから内陸県で唯一漁港を持ち、日本の漁港一覧と、海に面する5府県より多い。
sen.e: Shiga is the only inland prefecture that has fishing ports, the number of which is greater than that of other five prefectures that face sea.
sen.cmt: 日本文の意味が理解し難いので、推測をまじえて書きました。
sen.e: Shiga, in which Lake Biwa is located, is the only inland prefecture that has fishing ports, the number of which is greater than that of other five prefectures that face sea.
sen.cmt: 「琵琶湖があることから」→訳漏れのため訳出しました。
sen.e: Shiga, in which Lake Biwa is located, is the only inland prefecture that has fishing ports, the number of which is greater than that of other five prefectures that face sea.

sen.j: 日本海が海上交易の中心だった明治以前には、若狭湾で陸揚げされた物資が琵琶湖を通じて京都、さらには淀川経由で大阪方面へと運ばれており、内水系の重要港湾が数多く存在した。
sen.e: When Japan Sea was the center of commerce at sea before the Meiji period, goods landed from Wakasa Bay were carried to Kyoto via Lake Biwa, and then to Osaka via the Yodo-gawa River, which meant that there were a lot of important inland water ports in Shiga.

When Japan Sea was the center of commerce at sea before the Meiji period, goods landed from Wakasa Bay were carried to Kyoto via Lake Biwa, and then to Osaka via the Yodo-gawa River, which meant that there were a lot of important inland water ports in Shiga.

When Japan Sea was the center of commerce at sea before the Meiji period, goods landed from Wakasa Bay were carried to Kyoto via Lake Biwa, and then to Osaka via the Yodo-gawa River, which meant that there were a lot of important inland water ports in Shiga.

sen.j: 東海道・東山道（中山道）・北陸道の合流地であることから、陸上交通の要衝でもあった。
sen.e: Since Shiga was also a meeting point of Tokai-do Road, Tosan-do Road (Nakasen-do Road) and Hokuriku-do Road, it was a strategic stop for land transport.
Since Shiga was also a meeting point of Tokai-do Road, Tosan-do Road (Nakasen-do Road) and Hokuriku-do Road, it was a strategic stop for land transport.
Since Shiga was also a meeting point of Tokai-do Road, Tosan-do Road (Nakasen-do Road) and Hokuriku-do Road, it was a strategic stop for land transport.

sen.j: そのため中世から近代にかけて近江商人と呼ばれる近江出身の商人が全国各地で活躍するに至った。
sen.e: Therefore, merchants from Omi, who were called 'Omi shonin (Omi merchants)' played active roles in various parts of Japan.
Therefore, merchants from Omi, who were called 'Omi shonin' (Omi merchants) played active roles in various parts of Japan.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置を移動
sen.e: Therefore, merchants from Omi, who were called 'Omi shonin' (Omi merchants) played active roles in various parts of Japan.

sen.j: 明治以降、汽船や鉄道の発達によって県内での物流の積み替え需要は激減し、長らく物流が通過するだけの県となった。
sen.e: After the Meiji period, the development of steamer lines and railroads decreased the demand for transhipment goods drastically, which made Shiga a prefecture through which goods only passed for a long time.

After the Meiji period, the development of steamer lines and railroads decreased the demand for transhipment goods drastically, which made Shiga a prefecture through which goods only passed for a long time.

After the Meiji period, the development of steamer lines and railroads decreased the demand for transhipment goods drastically, which made Shiga a prefecture through which goods only passed for a long time.

sen.j: 戦後、高速道路の整備やトラック流通の興隆に伴って滋賀県の交通利便のよさが再注目されるようになり、近畿地方の流通拠点や工場の進出が進んだ。
sen.e: After the second World War, because of the maintenance of expressways and the rise of cargo truck transportation, the traffic convenience in Shiga attracted attention again, a lot of transportation bases for Kinki region and factories were established.

After the second World War, because of the maintenance of expressways and the rise of cargo truck transportation, the traffic convenience in Shiga attracted attention again, a lot of transportation bases for the Kinki region and factories were established.
sen.cmt: for the Kinki regionとしました。
sen.e: After the second World War, because of the maintenance of expressways and the rise of cargo truck transportation, the traffic convenience in Shiga attracted attention again, a lot of transportation bases for the Kinki region and factories were established.

sen.j: 平成に入ってからは、西日本旅客鉄道のアーバンネットワーク拡大によって大阪都市圏のベッドタウンとしても注目されるようになり、従来からの京都都市圏の性格と合わせて、地方では数少ない人口増加県となっている。
sen.e: Since 1989 (the beginning of the Heisei period), Shiga has attracted attention as a bedtown for Osaka urban zone, and owing to the feature of Kyoto urban area as in the past and the expand of the Urban Network of West Japan Railway Company (JR West) has increased its population, which is quite rare in rural areas.

Since 1989 (the beginning of the Heisei period), Shiga has attracted attention as a bedtown for Osaka urban zone, and owing to the feature of Kyoto urban area as in the past and the expand of the Urban Network of West Japan Railway Company (JR West) has increased its population, which is quite rare in rural areas.

Since 1989 (the beginning of the Heisei period), Shiga has attracted attention as a bedtown for Osaka urban zone, and owing to the feature of Kyoto urban area as in the past and the expand of the Urban Network of West Japan Railway Company (JR West) has increased its population, which is quite rare in rural areas.

sen.j: ただし開発が進んでいるのは京阪神に近い県南部であり、以前からあった県北部との経済格差が広がる事態となっている。
sen.e: However, only the southern part, which is close to 'Keihanshin (Osaka, Kyoto and Kobe)' has developed and the economic between the southern and northern parts, which had been problematic, has widened.

However, only the southern part, which is close to 'Keihanshin' (Osaka, Kyoto and Kobe) has developed and the economic gap between the southern and northern parts, which had been problematic, has widened.
sen.cmt: the economic→the economic gapに修正、クォーテーションの位置を移動
sen.e: However, only the southern part, which is close to 'Keihanshin' (Osaka, Kyoto and Kobe) has developed and the economic gap between the southern and northern parts, which had been problematic, has widened.

sen.j: 県の周囲を山脈・山地が取り囲み、中央部に琵琶湖が広がる。
sen.e: Shiga Prefecture is surrounded with mountainous lands and the center of it is occupied with Lake Biwa.
sen.cmt: 後述の「山地」の項からも山脈と山地の差異を明確にする必要が無い、と判断しましたので、山脈・山地をまとめてMountainous landsとしています。
sen.e: Shiga Prefecture is surrounded with mountainous lands and the center of it is occupied with Lake Biwa.
Shiga Prefecture is surrounded with mountainous lands and the center of it is occupied with Lake Biwa.

sen.j: 県土の大半が琵琶湖であるかのように思われがちだが、最も面積を占めるのは山林（県総面積の約半分）であり、琵琶湖が占める面積は県総面積の1/6程度である。
sen.e: Although some think a large portion of Shiga Prefecture is occupied by Lake Biwa, it is forests that occupy the largest area (approximately half of the total area of the prefecture, and the area of Lake Biwa is approximately one-sixth of the prefecture's total area.

Although some think a large portion of Shiga Prefecture is occupied by Lake Biwa, it is forests that occupy the largest area (approximately half of the total area of the prefecture), and the area of Lake Biwa is approximately one-sixth of the prefecture's total area.
sen.cmt: カッコの片方を補いました。
sen.e: Although some think a large portion of Shiga Prefecture is occupied by Lake Biwa, it is forests that occupy the largest area (approximately half of the total area of the prefecture), and the area of Lake Biwa is approximately one-sixth of the prefecture's total area.

sen.j: 山地：比良山地、野坂山地、伊吹山地、鈴鹿山脈
sen.e: Mountainous lands: Hira Mountain Country, Nosaka mountain range, Suzuka mountain range
Mountainous lands: Hira mountain range, Nosaka mountain range, Ibuki mountain range, Suzuka mountain range
sen.cmt: Hira Mountain Country→Hira mountain rangeとし、「伊吹山地」→訳漏れのため訳出しました。
sen.e: Mountainous lands: Hira mountain range, Nosaka mountain range, Ibuki mountain range, Suzuka mountain range

sen.j: 山：伊吹山、比叡山、比良山、三上山（近江富士）
sen.e: Mountains:Mt. Ibuki, Mt.Hiei, Mt.Hira, Mt. Mikami (Omi-Fuji)
Mountains: Mt. Ibuki, Mt.Hiei, Mt.Hira, Mt. Mikami (Omi-Fuji)
Mountains: Mt. Ibuki, Mt.Hiei, Mt.Hira, Mt. Mikami (Omi-Fuji)

sen.j: 盆地：近江盆地

sen.j: 丘：水口丘陵、饗庭野台地
sen.e: Hills:Minakuchi Hills, Aebano tableland

sen.j: 湖：琵琶湖、余呉湖、西の湖
sen.e: Lakes: Lake Biwa, Lake Yogo, Nishi-no-ko Lake
Lakes: Lake Biwa, Lake Yogo, Nishi no ko Lake

sen.j: 川：安曇川、姉川、犬上川、愛知川、日野川、野洲川、淀川
sen.e: Rivers: Ado-gawa River, Ane-gawa River, Inukami-gawa River, Echi-gawa River, Hino-gawa River, Yasu-gawa River, Yodo-gawa River
Rivers: Ado-gawa River, Ane-gawa River, Inukami-gawa River, Echi-gawa River, Hino-gawa River, Yasu-gawa River, Yodo-gawa River
Rivers: Ado-gawa River, Ane-gawa River, Inukami-gawa River, Echi-gawa River, Hino-gawa River, Yasu-gawa River, Yodo-gawa River

sen.j: 全域が内陸性気候で、北部は日本海側気候、南部は瀬戸内海式気候を併せ持つ。
sen.e: The entire area of the prefecture has inland climate, and nothern area and southern area also has climate of Japan Sea area and Seto Inland Sea climate, respectively.
The entire area of the prefecture has inland climate, and nothern area and southern area also have climate of Japan Sea area and Seto Inland Sea climate, respectively.
sen.cmt: nothern area and southern area also haveとしました。
sen.e: The entire area of the prefecture has inland climate, and nothern area and southern area also have climate of Japan Sea area and Seto Inland Sea climate, respectively.

sen.j: 北部や山間部には豪雪地帯が広がり、なかでも県最北端の余呉町は近畿地方で唯一の特別豪雪地帯に指定されている。
sen.e: A snowy area spreads over the northern area and mountain-ringed regions, and 'Yogo-cho' located at the farthest north of the prefecture is counted as the only special snowy area in Kinki region.
A snowy area spreads over the northern area and mountain areas, and 'Yogo-cho' located at the farthest north of the prefecture is counted as the only special snowy area in the Kinki region.
sen.cmt: mountain-ringed regions→mountain areas、in the Kinki regionとしました。
sen.e: A snowy area spreads over the northern area and mountain areas, and 'Yogo-cho' located at the farthest north of the prefecture is counted as the only special snowy area in the Kinki region.

sen.j: 1981年には余呉町中河内で積雪量6m55cmを記録している。
sen.e: The snow accumulation of 6m55cm was recorded in Nakakawachi, Yogo-cho, in 1981.
The snow accumulation of 6m55cm was recorded in Nakakawachi, Yogo-cho, in 1981.
The snow accumulation of 6m55cm was recorded in Nakakawachi, Yogo-cho, in 1981.

sen.e: Koto Prefectural natural park
Koto Prefectural Natural Park
sen.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 滋賀県は古くから開発が行われた土地である。
sen.e: The development of Shiga prefecture started a long time ago.
The development of Shiga Prefecture started a long time ago.
sen.cmt: prefectureの頭文字を大文字に修正
sen.e: The development of Shiga Prefecture started a long time ago.

sen.j: 奈良・京都・大坂への物資や人材の供給源や中継地、あるいは都と東国・北国とを結ぶ要衝として発展し、日本の歴史に関わって来た。
sen.e: Shiga has been greatly related with Japanese history by developing as a supply source or a stopping point of materials and/or workforce to Nara, Kyoto and Osaka and as a strategic stop connecting the capital and eastern and northern areas.

Shiga has been greatly related with Japanese history by developing as a supply source or a stopping point of materials and/or workforce to Nara, Kyoto and Osaka and as a strategic stop connecting the capital and eastern and northern areas.

Shiga has been greatly related with Japanese history by developing as a supply source or a stopping point of materials and/or workforce to Nara, Kyoto and Osaka and as a strategic stop connecting the capital and eastern and northern areas.

tit.e: From Ancient Times to Medieval Times
From Ancient Times to Medieval Times
From Ancient Times to Medieval Times

sen.j: 国造が分立した時代には、滋賀県はヤマト王権の領土に入っていた。
sen.e: When there were a lot of 'Kuni no miyatsuko (Local ruling families in ancient Japan),' Shiga was in the territory of 'Yamato sovereignty (the ancient Japan sovereignty).'
When there were a lot of 'Kuni no miyatsuko' (Local ruling families in ancient Japan), Shiga was in the territory of 'Yamato sovereignty' (the ancient Japan sovereignty).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置を移動
sen.e: When there were a lot of 'Kuni no miyatsuko' (Local ruling families in ancient Japan), Shiga was in the territory of 'Yamato sovereignty' (the ancient Japan sovereignty).

sen.j: 飛鳥時代には近江宮、奈良時代には紫香楽宮や保良宮が置かれた。
sen.e: Omi no Miya Palace' was established in the Asuka period and 'Shigaraki no Miya Palace' and 'Hora no Miya Palace' were established in the Nara period.
Omi no Miya Palace' was established in the Asuka period and 'Shigaraki no Miya Palace' and 'Hora no Miya Palace' were established in the Nara period.
Omi no Miya Palace' was established in the Asuka period and 'Shigaraki no Miya Palace' and 'Hora no Miya Palace' were established in the Nara period.

sen.j: 壬申の乱や藤原仲麻呂の乱といった戦乱の舞台となることも度々あった。
sen.e: Shiga became the stage for wars several times, including 'Jinshin War' and 'FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's War'.
Shiga became the stage for wars several times, including 'Jinshin War' and 'FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's War.'
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を移動
sen.e: Shiga became the stage for wars several times, including 'Jinshin War' and 'FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's War.'

sen.j: 平安中期より佐々木氏が近江に起こった。
sen.e: Sasaki clan became influential in Omi in the middle of the Heian Period.
The Sasaki clan became influential in Omi in the middle of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: The Sasaki clanに修正、Periodの頭文字を小文字に変更
sen.e: The Sasaki clan became influential in Omi in the middle of the Heian period.

sen.j: この佐々木氏は、源頼朝が関東地方で勃興するとこれに積極的に加わり、近江一国の守護職を得た。
sen.e: When MINAMOTO no Yoritomo raised his army in Kanto region, the Omi Sasaki clan took part in it positively and gained Omi shugoshiki (provincial constables of Omi Province).
When MINAMOTO no Yoritomo raised his army in the Kanto region, the Omi Sasaki clan took part in it positively and gained Omi shugoshiki (provincial constables of Omi Province).
sen.cmt: in the Kanto regionとしました。
sen.e: When MINAMOTO no Yoritomo raised his army in the Kanto region, the Omi Sasaki clan took part in it positively and gained Omi shugoshiki (provincial constables of Omi Province).

sen.j: 以降、六角氏や京極氏と分かれながら、佐々木一族は戦国時代_(日本)に至るまで近江国を支配した。
sen.e: Afterwards the Sasaki clan, dividing into Rokkaku clan and Kyogoku clan, governed Omi Province until the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
Afterwards the Sasaki clan, dividing into the Rokkaku clan and the Kyogoku clan, governed Omi Province until the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
sen.cmt: the Rokkaku clan, the Kyogoku clanに修正
sen.e: Afterwards the Sasaki clan, dividing into the Rokkaku clan and the Kyogoku clan, governed Omi Province until the Sengoku period (period of warring states).

sen.j: 南北朝期にはばさら大名で有名な佐々木道誉（高氏）が出て京極家の勢威を伸ばした。
sen.e: Doyo SASAKI (Takauji) from the Kyogoku clan, famous as 'Basara Daimyo (a foppery feudal lord)' made the Kyogoku clan more influential in the Northern and Southern Dynasties period.
sen.cmt: 「京極氏出身の」という意味の語句を加えています。
sen.e: Doyo (Takauji) SASAKI from the Kyogoku clan, famous as 'Basara Daimyo' (a foppery feudal lord) made the Kyogoku clan more influential in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.
sen.cmt: the Northern and Southern Dynasties period→the period of the Northern and Southern Courtsに修正、(Takauji)の位置を移動、クォーテーションの位置を移動
sen.e: Doyo (Takauji) SASAKI from the Kyogoku clan, famous as 'Basara Daimyo' (a foppery feudal lord) made the Kyogoku clan more influential in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

sen.j: 本願寺蓮如の大布教が始まると、大津付近は一向宗色が強くなった。
sen.e: When Rennyo in Hongan-ji Temple started large propagation, the Ikko sect became influention around Otsu.
When Rennyo in Hongan-ji Temple started large propagation, the Ikko sect became influention around Otsu.
When Rennyo in Hongan-ji Temple started large propagation, the Ikko sect became influention around Otsu.

sen.j: このため、これを喜ばない比叡山が度々攻撃を仕掛けた。
sen.e: Mt. Hiei's priests did not like that tendency and often attacked the Ikko believers in Otsu.
Mt. Hiei's priests did not like that tendency and often attacked the Ikko believers in Otsu.
Mt. Hiei's priests did not like that tendency and often attacked the Ikko believers in Otsu.

sen.j: 比叡山東麓の坂本 (大津市)は一向宗の堅田と経済的にも対立していたことから、両者の抗争は頻繁であった。
sen.e: Since Sakamoto (Otsu City), which is located at the eastern foot of Mt. Hiei, was against Katada, where the Ikko sect was influential, in economic and religious ways, the two often had conflicts.
Since Sakamoto (Otsu City), which is located at the eastern foot of Mt. Hiei, was against Katada, where the Ikko sect was influential, in economic and religious ways, the two often had conflicts.
Since Sakamoto (Otsu City), which is located at the eastern foot of Mt. Hiei, was against Katada, where the Ikko sect was influential, in economic and religious ways, the two often had conflicts.

sen.j: この後に蓮如は大津に一向宗拠点を構えたため、大津が栄えることとなった。
sen.e: Afterwards Rennyo.
Afterwards Rennyo.
Afterwards Rennyo made Otsu a base of the Ikko sect, which led to the prosperity of Otsu.
sen.cmt: Webで確かめると、「大津に一向宗拠点を構えたため、大津が栄えることとなった」があるので補足して翻訳しました。

sen.j: 戦国時代に入ると、北近江に浅井氏が台頭する。
sen.e: The Asai clan gained power in 'Kitaomi (the nothern part of Omi)' in the Sengoku period.
The Asai clan gained power in Kitaomi (the nothern part of Omi) in the Sengoku period.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除
sen.e: The Asai clan gained power in Kitaomi (the nothern part of Omi) in the Sengoku period.

sen.j: 形の上で京極氏を奉じた浅井氏は南近江を領する六角氏と抗争する。
sen.e: The Asai clan, who served the Kyogoku clan as a matter of form, fought against the Rokkaku clan, who owened 'Minamiomi (the southern part of Omi).'
The Asai clan, who served the Kyogoku clan as a matter of form, fought against the Rokkaku clan, who owned Minamiomi (the southern part of Omi).
sen.cmt: ownedのスペルミス修正、クォーテーション削除
sen.e: The Asai clan, who served the Kyogoku clan as a matter of form, fought against the Rokkaku clan, who owned Minamiomi (the southern part of Omi).

sen.j: 織田信長と結んだ浅井長政に至って六角氏を駆逐するが、後に将軍の信長包囲網に加わって信長に抵抗、1573年に滅亡する。
sen.e: Although when Nagamasa ASAI had once a military agreement with Nobunaga ODA and drove out the Rokkaku clan, later Nagamasa, joining the Shogun's alliance against Nobunaga, fought against Nobunaga and was defeated in 1573.

Although when Nagamasa ASAI had once a military agreement with Nobunaga ODA and drove out the Rokkaku clan, later Nagamasa, joining the Shogun's alliance against Nobunaga, fought against Nobunaga and was defeated in 1573.

Although when Nagamasa ASAI had once a military agreement with Nobunaga ODA and drove out the Rokkaku clan, later Nagamasa, joining the Shogun's alliance against Nobunaga, fought against Nobunaga and was defeated in 1573.

sen.j: 近江国を支配圏に入れた信長は、根拠地として近江盆地に安土城を建設する。
sen.e: Nobunaga, who now controled Omi Province, established Azuchi-jo Castle in Omi Basin as his base ground.
Nobunaga, who now controlled Omi Province, established Azuchi-jo Castle in Omi Basin as his base ground.
Nobunaga, who now controlled Omi Province, established Azuchi-jo Castle in Omi Basin as his base ground.

sen.j: 信長の死後は畿内を地盤とする豊臣秀吉と、越前国福井藩を地盤とする柴田勝家の係争地となり、近江北端部で行われた賤ヶ岳の戦いにおける秀吉の勝利で決着が着けられた。
sen.e: After Nobunaga's death, Omi became the debatable ground between Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and Katstuie SHIBATA, whose foundation was laid in 'Kinai' and 'Fukui Domain of Echigo Province,' respectively, and the conflict was settled when Hideyoshi's army won at the Battle of Shizugatake.

After Nobunaga's death, Omi became the debatable ground between Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and Katstuie SHIBATA, whose foundations were laid in 'Kinai' and 'Fukui Domain of Echigo Province,' respectively, and the conflict was settled when Hideyoshi's army won at the Battle of Shizugatake.

After Nobunaga's death, Omi became the debatable ground between Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and Katstuie SHIBATA, whose foundations were laid in 'Kinai' and 'Fukui Domain of Echigo Province,' respectively, and the conflict was settled when Hideyoshi's army won at the Battle of Shizugatake.

sen.j: 秀吉は初めての領地が長浜市であった関係もあり、多数の近江国民を主に事務方として登用した。
sen.e: Partly because Hideyoshi's first territory was Nagahama city, he promoted a lot of people from Omi as the clerical staff.
Partly because Hideyoshi's first territory was Nagahama City, he promoted a lot of people from Omi as the clerical staff.
sen.cmt: cityの頭文字を大文字に変更
sen.e: Partly because Hideyoshi's first territory was Nagahama City, he promoted a lot of people from Omi as the clerical staff.

sen.j: 石田三成もその1人である。
sen.e: Mitsunari Ishida was one of them.
Mitsunari ISHIDA was one of them.
Mitsunari ISHIDA was one of them.

sen.j: そのことによって生じた近江閥と秀吉出身地の尾張閥の対立が関ヶ原の戦いを促したとも言われる。
sen.e: The promostion is said to have caused a conflict between the Omi faction and the faction of Owari, Hideyoshi's birth place, which later led to the Battle of Sekigahara.
The promostion is said to have caused a conflict between the Omi faction and the faction of Owari, Hideyoshi's birth place, which later led to the Battle of Sekigahara.
The promostion is said to have caused a conflict between the Omi faction and the faction of Owari, Hideyoshi's birth place, which later led to the Battle of Sekigahara.

sen.j: また戦国時代から江戸時代にかけての甲賀郡では甲賀流忍者が活動していた。
sen.e: In Koga gun(county), Omi Province, Koga ninja played important roles over the Sengoku period and the early in the Edo period.
In Koka County, Omi Province, Koga ninja played important roles over the Sengoku period and the early in the Edo period.
In Koka County, Omi Province, Koga ninja played important roles over the Sengoku period and the early in the Edo period.

sen.j: 徳川家康は、徳川氏における精鋭軍を率いる井伊氏を、関ヶ原に近い彦根城に入封させて西国の抑えとし、北近江は彦根藩の領土となった。
sen.e: Ieyasu TOKUGAWA had the Ii clan, who led Tokugawa's elite force, enter Hikone-jo Castle so that the Ii clan would control Saigoku (western part of Japan), and 'Kitaomi' belonged to the Hikone domain.
Ieyasu TOKUGAWA had the Ii clan, who led Tokugawa's elite force, enter Hikone-jo Castle so that the Ii clan would control Saigoku (western part of Japan), and Kitaomi belonged to the Hikone Domain.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除、domainの頭文字を大文字に変更
sen.e: Ieyasu TOKUGAWA had the Ii clan, who led Tokugawa's elite force, enter Hikone-jo Castle so that the Ii clan would control Saigoku (western part of Japan), and Kitaomi belonged to the Hikone Domain.

sen.j: また、江戸時代にあった藩として、膳所藩、水口藩、大溝藩、西大路藩、近江宮川藩、山上藩、三上藩、交代寄合の最上家の大森陣屋、交代寄合の朽木家の朽木陣屋があった。
sen.e: In the Edo period, Shiga had Zeze, Minakuchi, Omizo, Nishioji, Omi-Miyagawa, Yamagami, and Mikami Domains and Omori 'Jinya (regional government office) of the Mogami family and Kutsuki 'Jinya' as 'Kotaiyoriai (alternate 'yoriai', a family status of samurai warriors in the Edo period).
sen.cmt: 日本文の意味を正しく理解できているかどうか自信がありません。そのため、日本文と違う意味の英文になっているかもしれません。
sen.e: In the Edo period, Shiga had Zeze, Minakuchi, Omizo, Nishioji, Omi-Miyagawa, Yamagami, and Mikami Domains and Omori Jinya (regional government office) of the Mogami family given the title of Kotaiyoriai (high-ranking liege vassals) and Kutsuki Jinya of the Kutsuki family given the title of Kotaiyoriai.
sen.cmt: 「朽木家の」→訳漏れのため訳出、スペース・クォーテーション消去、原文の内容に沿うよう一部訳し直しました。
sen.e: In the Edo period, Shiga had Zeze, Minakuchi, Omizo, Nishioji, Omi-Miyagawa, Yamagami, and Mikami Domains and Omori Jinya (regional government office) of the Mogami family given the title of Kotaiyoriai (high-ranking liege vassals) and Kutsuki Jinya of the Kutsuki family given the title of Kotaiyoriai.

sen.j: 江戸時代初期には将軍上洛用御殿が近江国内に水口城のほかに、永原御殿、伊庭御殿、柏原御殿があった。
sen.e: In the early Edo period, there were four places where Shogun stayed when he went to Kyoto: Nagahara Goten (palace), Iba Goten, and Kashiwabara Goten in addition to Minaguchi-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In the early Edo period, in Omi Province there were four places where Shogun stayed when he went to Kyoto: Nagahara Goten (palace), Iba Goten, and Kashiwabara Goten in addition to Minaguchi-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 「近江国内に」→訳漏れのため訳出しました。
sen.e: In the early Edo period, in Omi Province there were four places where Shogun stayed when he went to Kyoto: Nagahara Goten (palace), Iba Goten, and Kashiwabara Goten in addition to Minaguchi-jo Castle.

sen.j: が、3代将軍家光以降は上洛も途切れ御殿も次第に老朽化して、廃れていった。
sen.e: However, from Iemitsu TOKUGAWA, the third Shogun on, Shoguns seldom went to Kyoto, and the palaces became old and ruined.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, from Iemitsu TOKUGAWA, the third Shogun on, Shoguns seldom went to Kyoto, and the palaces became old and ruined.
However, starting with Iemitsu TOKUGAWA, the third Shogun, the Shoguns seldom went to Kyoto, and the palaces became old and ruined.
sen.cmt: 「3代将軍家光以降」の表現を変更しました。

sen.j: また江戸時代には、鎌倉時代から続く商工業が飛躍的に発達し、犬上・愛知・神崎・蒲生・高島の各郡、特に八幡 (近江八幡市)・日野町 (滋賀県)・五個荘町などから近江商人を多く輩出した。
sen.e: In the Edo period, trade and manufacture, which started in the Kamakura period, markedly developed and such counties as Inukami, Echi, Kanzaki, Gamo, and Takashima, especially Hachiman (Omihachiman City), Hino-cho (Shiga Prefecture) and Gokasho-cho produced a lot of Omi merchants.

In the Edo period, trade and manufacture, which started in the Kamakura period, markedly developed and such counties as Inukami, Echi, Kanzaki, Gamo, and Takashima, especially Hachiman (Omihachiman City), Hino-cho (Shiga Prefecture) and Gokasho-cho produced a lot of Omi merchants.

In the Edo period, trade and manufacture, which started in the Kamakura period, markedly developed and such counties as Inukami, Echi, Kanzaki, Gamo, and Takashima, especially Hachiman (Omihachiman City), Hino-cho (Shiga Prefecture) and Gokasho-cho produced a lot of Omi merchants.

sen.j: 廃藩置県後、1876年8月21日に敦賀県が分割され、嶺南が滋賀県に編入したため、若狭湾に面していた時期もあった。
sen.e: After 'Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures)' on August 21, 1876, Tsuruga Prefecture was devided and Reinan was incorporated into Shiga Pregecture, so at that time Shiga Prefecture faced to Wakasa Bay.

After the Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures) on August 21, 1876, Tsuruga Prefecture was devided and Reinan was incorporated into Shiga Prefecture, so at that time Shiga Prefecture faced to Wakasa Bay.
sen.cmt: After the Haihan-chikenとし、クォーテーション削除、Prefectureのスペルミス修正
sen.e: After the Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures) on August 21, 1876, Tsuruga Prefecture was devided and Reinan was incorporated into Shiga Prefecture, so at that time Shiga Prefecture faced to Wakasa Bay.

sen.j: 4年半後の1881年2月7日の福井県発足によって嶺南は滋賀県から分離され、内陸県である現在の領域となった。
sen.e: However, four and half years later, on February 7, 1881, Fukui Prefecture was established and Reinan was separated from Shiga and incorporated into Fukui, which resulted in making Shiga the present inland prefecture.

However, four and half years later, on February 7, 1881, Fukui Prefecture was established and Reinan was separated from Shiga and incorporated into Fukui, which resulted in making Shiga the present inland prefecture.

tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 滋賀県は中央部に広大な琵琶湖を持つために、湖を挟んだ地域同士で特徴が異なることが多い。
sen.e: Since Shiga Prefecture has vast Lake Biwa in the middle of it, the features vary according to different areas surrounding the lake.
Since Shiga Prefecture has vast Lake Biwa in the middle of it, the features vary according to different areas surrounding the lake.

sen.j: 県西部と県東部
sen.e: The Western Part and the Eastern Part of the Prefecture
The Western Part and the Eastern Part of the Prefecture
The Western Part and the Eastern Part of the Prefecture

sen.j: 西部（大津市と高島市）は畿内と若狭湾・北陸とを短絡する要地であり、江戸時代には西近江路・鯖街道が通っていた。
sen.e: The western part (Otsu and Takashima cities) is a key area which connects 'Kinai' and Wakasa Bay/ Hokuriku region in the shortest way and Nishiomiji Road and Saba-kaido Road (the highway used to transport fish such as 'saba' (mackerel) to Japan's ancient capital, Kyoto) went through the part in the Edo period.

The western part (Otsu and Takashima Cities) is a key area which connects 'Kinai' and Wakasa Bay/Hokuriku region in the shortest way and Nishiomiji Road and Saba-kaido Road (the highway used to transport fish such as 'saba' [mackerel] to Japan's ancient capital, Kyoto) went through the part in the Edo period.

sen.j: 現在もそれらを踏襲する国道161号・国道367号や湖西線が通る。

sen.j: 平野部が少なく、琵琶湖のすぐ近くまで比良山地が迫る。
sen.e: There are few plains and Hira Mountain Country come very close to Lake Biwa.
There are few plains and Hira mountain range comes very close to Lake Biwa.

sen.j: 一方の東部（草津市・彦根市・米原市・長浜市など）は畿内と東国・北国を結ぶ要地であり、律令制には東山道、江戸時代には東海道・中山道・北国街道が通っていた。
sen.e: On the other hand, the eastern part (Kusatsu, Hikone, Maibara, Nagahama cities) is a key area which connects 'Kinai' and eatstern and nothern regions of Japan: In the days of 'the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code)' Tosando ran there and in the Edo period, Tokaido, Nakasendo, and Hokkoku Kaido Road went through the area.

On the other hand, the eastern part (Kusatsu, Hikone, Maibara, Nagahama Cities) is a key area which connects 'Kinai' and eatstern and nothern regions of Japan; in the days of the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) Tosando ran there and in the Edo period, Tokaido, Nakasendo, and Hokkoku Kaido Road went through the area.

sen.j: 現在もそれらを踏襲する名神高速道路・新名神高速道路・北陸自動車道・国道1号・国道8号・国道21号や東海道新幹線・東海道本線・草津線・北陸本線が通る。
sen.e: Roads and railways that have adhered to the roads mentioned above go through the area: Meishin Expressway, Shin Meishin Expressway, Hokuriku Expressway, Route 1, Route 8, and Route 21, and Tokaido Shinkansen, JR Tokaido Main Line, JR Kusatsu Line, and Hokuriku Main Line.

sen.j: 平野部が大きく開けており、古代より開発が進められた。
sen.e: There is a large plain in this area, which has been developed since ancient times.
There is a large plain in this area, which has been developed since ancient times.

sen.j: 県南部と県北部
sen.e: The Southern Part and the Northern Part of the Prefecture
The Southern Part and the Northern Part of the Prefecture
The Southern Part and the Northern Part of the Prefecture

sen.j: 京阪に近い南部（大津市・草津市・甲賀市など）は文化的に京阪の影響を強く受け、現在は通勤圏として「滋賀府民」の多い地域となっている。
sen.e: The southern part (including Otsu, Kusatsu, and Koga cities), which is close to Kyoto and Osaka, has beeen culturally influenced by Kyoto and Osaka, and since a lot of people called commute to Kyoto and Osaka from this part, they are called 'Shiga Fumin (those living in Shiga but spend most of their time in Kyoto or Osaka).'

The southern part (including Otsu, Kusatsu, and Koga Cities), which is close to Kyoto and Osaka, has been culturally influenced by Kyoto and Osaka, and since a lot of people commute to Kyoto and Osaka from this part, they are called 'Shiga Fumin' (those living in Shiga but spend most of their time in Kyoto or Osaka).
sen.cmt: citiesの頭文字を大文字に変更、beenのスペルミス修正、クォーテーションの位置を移動、a lot of people called commute→a lot of people commuteとしました。
sen.e: The southern part (including Otsu, Kusatsu, and Koga Cities), which is close to Kyoto and Osaka, has been culturally influenced by Kyoto and Osaka, and since a lot of people commute to Kyoto and Osaka from this part, they are called 'Shiga Fumin' (those living in Shiga but spend most of their time in Kyoto or Osaka).

sen.j: とりわけ大津市は京都市中心部から約10kmしか離れておらず、JR大津駅からJR京都駅までは各駅停車でも9分で行き来ができる。
sen.e: Especially Otsu is close to Kyoto: It is approximately 10 km from the center of Kyoto city to Otsu city, and it takes only nine minutes from JR Kyoto station to JR Otsu station even by train that stops at every station.

Especially Otsu is close to Kyoto; it is approximately 10 km from the center of Kyoto City to Otsu City, and it takes only nine minutes from JR Kyoto station to JR Otsu station even by train that stops at every station.
sen.cmt: cityの頭文字を大文字に修正、コロン→セミコロン、It→itとしました。
sen.e: Especially Otsu is close to Kyoto; it is approximately 10 km from the center of Kyoto City to Otsu City, and it takes only nine minutes from JR Kyoto station to JR Otsu station even by train that stops at every station.

sen.j: 一方京阪から遠い北部（彦根市・米原市・長浜市など）は京阪だけでなく北陸とも文化的に共通点を持つ。
sen.e: On the other hand, the northern part (including Hikone, Maibara and Nagahama cities), which is distant from Kyoto or Osaka, has a lot in common culturally not only with Kyoto and Osaka but also with Hokuriku region.

On the other hand, the northern part (including Hikone, Maibara and Nagahama Cities), which is distant from Kyoto or Osaka, has a lot in common culturally not only with Kyoto and Osaka but also with the Hokuriku region.
sen.cmt: the Hokuriku regionとし、citiesの頭文字を大文字に変更
sen.e: On the other hand, the northern part (including Hikone, Maibara and Nagahama Cities), which is distant from Kyoto or Osaka, has a lot in common culturally not only with Kyoto and Osaka but also with the Hokuriku region.

sen.j: 現在は南部に比べて宅地開発などが遅れており、「南北格差」を主張する声がある。
sen.e: The southern part is more advanced than the northern part in housing-land development, and some say there is 'a gap between North and South.'

sen.j: 大津と彦根の都市間対立もあり、明治24年と昭和11年の2度、大津と彦根で県庁の誘致合戦が起こっている。
sen.e: There has been an inter-city between Otsu and Hikone, and there were two bidding conflicts over Prefectural Government Office in 1891 (the 24th year in Meiji) and in 1936 (the 11th year in Showa).

sen.j: 琵琶湖には海津大崎など数々の景勝地があり、とりわけ近江八景は近世より日本有数の名勝として知られた。
sen.e: Lake Biwa has various beauty spots including Kaizu-osaki, and especially Omi Hakkei (Eight Views of Omi) have been famous as representatives of the most beautiful spots in Japan since recent times.
Lake Biwa has various beauty spots including Kaizu-osaki, and especially Omi Hakkei (Eight Views of Omi) have been famous as representatives of the most beautiful spots in Japan since recent times.
Lake Biwa has various beauty spots including Kaizu-osaki, and especially Omi Hakkei (Eight Views of Omi) have been famous as representatives of the most beautiful spots in Japan since recent times.

sen.j: 現在は湖水浴や釣り、クルージングなどのレクリエーション観光地でもある。
sen.e: Nowadays, you can enjoy various types of recreation in Lake Biwa, including fishing and cruising.
Nowadays, you can enjoy various types of recreation in Lake Biwa, including fishing and cruising.
Nowadays, you can enjoy various types of recreation in Lake Biwa, including fishing and cruising.

sen.j: 琵琶湖以外の自然環境では、京阪神や中京圏から登山客やスキーレジャー客を集めているほか、近年では里山や田園、針江区などがアグリツーリズム・エコツーリズムの観点で見直されつつある。
sen.e: In addition to visitors to Lake Biwa, not only mountain climbers and skiiers come to Shiga from Keihanshin and Chukyo areas but also quite a lot of people are attracted to 'Satoyama (farming landscape near the hills and mountains in Japan)', rural sites and Harie District from the viewpoints of agritourism and ecotourism.

In addition to visitors to Lake Biwa, not only mountain climbers and skiiers come to Shiga from Keihanshin and Chukyo areas but also quite a lot of people are attracted to 'Satoyama' (farming landscape near the hills and mountains in Japan), rural sites and Harie District from the viewpoints of agritourism and ecotourism.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置を移動、余分なスペース消去
sen.e: In addition to visitors to Lake Biwa, not only mountain climbers and skiiers come to Shiga from Keihanshin and Chukyo areas but also quite a lot of people are attracted to 'Satoyama' (farming landscape near the hills and mountains in Japan), rural sites and Harie District from the viewpoints of agritourism and ecotourism.

sen.j: 奈良や京都に近いこと、太平洋戦争の戦災や戦後の乱開発を免れたことなどから、社寺・城郭・伝統的景観などの歴史的観光資源も豊かである。
sen.e: Partly because Shiga is close to Nara and Kyoto, and partly because Shiga was saved from war damages of the World War II and the after-war overdevelopment, the prefecture is rich in historical sightseeing resources, including temples, shrines, castles and traditional landscapes.

Partly because Shiga is close to Nara and Kyoto, and partly because Shiga was saved from war damages of the World War II and the after-war overdevelopment, the prefecture is rich in historical sightseeing resources, including temples, shrines, castles and traditional landscapes.

Partly because Shiga is close to Nara and Kyoto, and partly because Shiga was saved from war damages of the World War II and the after-war overdevelopment, the prefecture is rich in historical sightseeing resources, including temples, shrines, castles and traditional landscapes.
